data.title: Great Place for a Quick Lunch
data.text: I met a friend here for lunch and not only was it quick, but I thought the lunch portions were huge for the price.  This place is not expensive and I thought the food was great.  The lunch specials are especially nice and it starts with a small bowl of soup.  My friend and I both opted for the sweet and sour soup.  The spicy sushi roll lunch was huge, and the small salad and edamame side was a great addition.  There was definitely enough food and in fact, I didn't finish everything.

data.title: Such a GREAT PLACE for Lunch! or Dinner
data.text: My favorite place to go for lunch, by myself or with friends.    The Sushi is always fresh and portions are generous!   Such a fun place to go.  Never feel alone there.

data.title: Great 50% Menu!
data.text: Good place for quick service, good sushi and 50% off menu.  They also have drink specials.  Not a fancy place.  There are also several TV's to watch shows or games.  Have been there at least 5 times and it's always good.

data.title: Just "Ordinary" Sushi - No atmosphere, Service is lacking
data.text:
When this restaurant first opened up they gave you a fresh cold orange cut up like a panda bear with your check, Then they changed to chocolate mints and now hard to get a thank you & smile.
This restaurant has definitely changed over the years.  Used to be more authentic sushi now its just "ordinary"  seems as if its just regular line cooks making sushi. The sushi is good but not "extra ordinary" or special.  The atmosphere is rushed at lunch not enough wait staff to handle  customers & take out orders too.  
Lunch is a good value $6.95 to $7.95 for entree, rice, salad, soup, & appetizer.  I had the sweet & sour chicken and it tasted like a frozen product but the rest of the lunch was fresh & very good.

data.title: Better options exist
data.text: We came in an hour before closing and were the only ones there, and honestly felt as though they were rushing us to leave.  Fish was not the freshest, and they were out of several options.  There are better restaurant options in the area, and better sushi options IMO.

data.title: OK sushi bar; loved the Las Vegas roll...
data.text:
I guess if you come here on a busy Friday night, it might take a while to be seated.. However, we saw 5 couples seated before our party of 3 while we waited for about 20-30 minutes.  I don't think I wouldn't have minded except the staff basically ignored us while they pointed others to their 2-person tables... then they finally remembered us (three of us who were blocking the front door since there was no other place to wait), and shoved us to the sushi bar.

I did enjoy the few rolls we ordered and really enjoyed the Las Vegas roll.  Otherwise, there was really nothing stand-out about this place to me.

data.title: Great Sushi, great prices
data.text: I have been going to this restaurant for years now. The food is consistently good and I'm always surprised at how reasonable it is. Love their Ahi tower, tuna tatake and the variety of their rolls. Service is efficient and friendly.

data.title: Nice Sushi Restaurant
data.text: Nice local sushi restaurant.  Prices are very reasonable daily specials and 50% menu.  The portions are large so be ready to share if you want more than one type of sushi.  Service is good.A few years back they had indigenous chefs making the sushi now it seems they are using typical line cooks who work other days at local fast food chains. Its in the details.  The previous chefs used to add decorative details and provide little extras to make the sushi special.  Now its fast food sushi but good fast food sushi.  I will definitely eat there again.

data.title: Very busy for a reason
data.text: Take a basic Sushi restaurant and add some very well priced specials with the custom rolls that Ahi has and you have an enjoyable evening of food. We love the fried rolls for a different portion and don't miss the Poke Salad.
